website_summaries.verdict: It might be overkill for most users, but it is a solid unit. However, The Chapin 20000 is cheaper and at least as effective.
pros: Heavy-duty build allows for more caustic mixes
Falls between household and commercial use

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 10mins (or less) - DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs to re-think this as a "preferred" item! Assembly was ok... though as other have said, seals and thread line up was a challenge. Tested w/water first to see, that went iffy, had to reposition the spray trigger spring (wouldn't stop spraying).. thought I got it all sorted out.. then after about 10mins of use, nozzle just dripped, tried to clear (?) (though don't know why it would clog that fast with just Round Up in it) laid it on side to try to decompress, but that didn't go well as I was sprayed with Monsanto's best...Yay!... Returning it ASAP...
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: great sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased 3 of these sprayers for removing rust on driveway (from well water sprinkler system), pest contol, and spray for ticks near the woods by our backyard. They do a great job. They are heavy duty, thick plastic. The spray is consistent. The handle is easy to grip. We have owned 1 for about 1.5 years and just purchased 2 more. I buy these over the more inexpensive one because it can handle the heavy chemicals without deteriorating or clogging. It is also easy to clean. I would recommend this for any hard chemicals!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cheap price if it won't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and knowing that many people had problems with this pump sprayer, it was cheap enough that I thought I'd give it a try. My application wouldn't require heavy use, only occasional. I put it all together, filled it with water as the instructions suggest, and gave it a try. On the first try, the gasket around the pump assembly leaked. I removed the pump, checked for any debris around the seal, made sure it was lubricated from the factory, and tried it again. Hisss-s-s-s . . . Oh well, I'm sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Chiacat

customer_reviews.title: Not to mention the waste of about $30
customer_reviews.text: ! CAUTION ! The pump disenegrated in first hour of use. During use of second gallon of cement sealer, while pumping, liquid exploded from the pump handle. After examining what occurred, the bottom seal on the pump completely disenegrated. NO way this is a Viton seal. Luckily my face was to the side and the liquid only got on my arm and leg. Not to mention the waste of about $30.00 worth of sealer. Scary product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this without pressure release valve
customer_reviews.text: I own two DB Smith gallon sprayer. On with pressure release valve and the other without. The one Amazon is selling is without pressure release valve. I think pressure release valve is absolutely necessary as you may want to release pressure when done using it. If you just open the cap with pressure inside, some liquid will burst out. I don't know why Amazon is selling one without the pressure release valve. I regret having bought this one. The one with pressure release valve that I got from homedepot works excellent. It's only one dollar more. You will not want to buy this without the pressure release valve.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for different chemicals. One for killing all weeds and one dedicated to lawn weeds only. They spray nice and pressurize easily in a few pumps. I just wish they had a pressure relief valve. To release the pressure when you are done you have to carefully unscrew the pump handle which gives you a little mist of chemicals out the top of the bottle. Always use protective gear! Overall I'm happy with these units. I hope this review was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is my first sprayer doesn't mean that I don't understand how it works. As a first time user, I found it being very simple to use and easy to maneuver with. The pressurized chamber will give a good amount of spray before you have to pump up the pressure again. The spray nozzle could be a little better, but like a spray bottle the tighter the nozzle is the finer the spray. So, test with water first for the spray of your liking. Like others said, cleaning is very important. Just fill it up with water, warm or hot water is best, and spray out the old stuff to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Had it for a week and used it twice for heavy duty degreasing on my semi truck and the top seal where they pump screws into is off track and leaking air. The sprayer is cheap and brittle. The screw handle doesn't ever stay locked into the pump so you can carry it around easily. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Very cheaply made!
customer_reviews.author: alex halterman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Me (125lb) woman
customer_reviews.text: Dr. SMITH's Pump Sprayer was just what I needed for my liquid lawn fertilizer. I needed something easy to spray due to arthritis...check. I did not want to spend half the day pumping it, bad back....check. I am not strong but wanted something reasonable in size that I could carry over my shoulder....check. I did my lawn and also used it with outdoor, marina water repellant which is fairly thick and it did a great job, not clogging one time. I am completely pleased with my purchase in every way. Bj
customer_reviews.author: BARBIE..OnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality Sprayer - 1 Star
customer_reviews.text: I normally do not like to write negative reviews, but this one clearly deserves one. I opened the box it seemed like a very nice sprayer. Just a few mins to assemble and pour my insect spray into the sprayer. Once I tried to pump or pressurize the tank it took over 20 pumps and it still had little or no pressure! I tried to spray and could not adjust the spray nozzle down to a small amount. It was either full spray or nothing......... so do your research and DONT BUY THIS ONE ............
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Not that great when using chemical concrete sealers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it had Viton Seals which I was told would be the kind of sprayer I needed for applying my concrete sealer. I had put down about 5 gallons of sealer when the hose connected to the main bottle disintegrated and sprayed concrete sealer all over my windows and outside door. Thankfully I purchased two and was able to finish the job with the hose from the newer bottle. The sprayer functioned well in all other areas, but be careful if you are spraying large quantitates of concrete sealer.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first garden sprayer, so I'm not qualified to compare this with other brands. With that said... The plastic body on this is seriously rugged. I was not prepared for how heavy duty the body was. The main seal is a good 1/8" thick and looks like it's ready for work. The pump/charging handle requires the user to push down and twist to engage the pump. Once pressurized just twist it back into place. I had to read the section in the manual to figure this out. Once I had it filed and charged the sprayer worked as expected. Shutting off the stream was easy and once shut off it stopped dispensing (no dripping).
customer_reviews.author: Ro Yo Mi

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this one!!!
customer_reviews.text: The spray is horrible. This is the third sprayer I own (for different uses, I like to keep the separate) and this is by far the worst. It doesn't matter how you adjust the screw at the base of the sprayer, at the tip, or even the very tip, you can't get anything but straight streams that are weak and off at an angle. No clogs. It's just junk. Wish we had just bought the same one I had before, but wanted it to look different. Thought it couldn't be too bad, i was wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Mamma Manda

customer_reviews.title: Spend The Extra Couple Bucks For The Smith
customer_reviews.text: It seems like every couple years my budget-priced sprayer would hit the trash due to a component failing or breaking even though it got very little use. I looked at option and decided to spend the extra couple bucks on this Smith sprayer and was glad I did Everything is better quality from the popular cheap one, from the hose to the plunger to the trigger nozzle. It's rated for bleach, too, which is s good thing since we use it for cleaning vinyl siding as often as we use it for pesticides.
customer_reviews.author: CoolBoomer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one main purpose: I needed to treat my rhododendrons for lace bugs. The bugs sit on the underside of the leaves and suck the life out of the leaves. Not only did this sprayer pump up very easily, but the pressure lasted a long time. The bend in the sprayer allowed me to get under the leaves and give them a thorough coating with insecticidal soap, which I hope will do the job. I will also use this for treating my fence boards next spring so they won't be green and icky after the long wet winter.
customer_reviews.author: alaffin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work and slow customer service
customer_reviews.text: Tried it first 1/2 year after I bought it, didn't work, CS took 4 days to respond so I threw it away and bought a different brand sprayer tank from a close by hardware store which works great. Would not recommend it for $20. Go to HomeDepot and buy one for $8.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dip

customer_reviews.title: Weed Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to spray weeds with. Used it about once a day for a few weeks, some times 2 times a day, doing both front and back yard. It's held up and served it's purpose pretty well. Only complaint I have is that I found I had to screw the top back on TIGHT to get it to work properly, which left it an absolute PAIN to unscrew. None the less, I'd still recommend this if you're looking for something to spray weeds and what not with.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, works well, is probably somewhat reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavier-duty sprayer than I've had in the past. I bought it to spread 5 gallons of a water-based sealer, and it worked great until the final fill, when it would not pressurize. I could not find anything wrong, so I unassembled the pump and hose assemblies (the instructions show you how) and reassembled them and everything worked again. I have never had to do that with a sprayer before so that is why I am not giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worked once
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. One for bug spray, the other for grass spray. The second time I went to pump up the one with bug spray, the liquid came flowing out the top. Seems like the seal between the plunger and top went bad. For this to happen after 1 use is pretty pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Not the best cheap sprayer I've had
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I wasn't expecting top quality. The wand and trigger are decent but it's hard to adjust the angle it wants to take in your hand because the hose is permanently attached instead of screwing on. I used the sprayer for about a half hour and the fitting attaching the hose to the tank had loosened and was leaking. It had been put on pretty firm but you can only screw it down so much without damaging plastic threads. I would not recommend for chemical spraying.
customer_reviews.author: NCHTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Many uses one gallon sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean the coils on my air conditioner, nasty stuff, work well did the job. Now what do I do with it, filled it with weed killer, did the job.Filled it with bleach cleaned my house siding . What's next..? I thought it would be a one use tool, now I find I can't do without it. Good quality easy to use, one gal size perfect for all my jobs. You can see through the container so you always know how much liquid you have. Would buy again good value.
customer_reviews.author: rch

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: This one failed after only a partial season of use. Very disappointed in the product. I had missed that it did not have a pressure release so I was unhappy about that and ordered a different product when it failed rather than trying to return it. The pump failed on this model and the trigger would stick and dribble solution. I would not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: -Stacey-

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap sprayer to spray weed killer around the yard. I picked this up on Amazon and did not have high hopes. This is actually made of great quality material and has a great pump on it - has a high pressure spray for a lower cost tank sprayer. I actually think this works better than my expensive Solo pump sprayer that cost ALOT more. Glad I picked this up.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Works great for water in a location without water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to spray water where I need it at my apartment. My apartment complex doesn't have any exterior water faucets, thus, no hose to wash anything. I bought this so I could wash off my welcome mat... rinse my engine bay without having to fill up a bucket and carry it downstairs, across the parking lot, and use a sponge... and even indoors to rinse cleaner off the walls of the shower/bath tub after cleaning them (since the shower head doesn't reach everything and filling up cups of water splashes outside the tub sometimes). It's been helping me a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: A Leaky Mess of Chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I can't even. The thing just leaked everywhere. It was leaking in so many places I couldn't even deal with it. How can you make a product to contain bleach and other chemicals and the thing is so cheap...so awful. It just leaked all over the place. Not good. Not nice. Not able to use. Disgusting and horrible. DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Ari

customer_reviews.title: Smith 190285 1-Gallon Bleach and Chemical Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Smith 190285 1-Gallon Bleach and Chemical Sprayer This is a great sprayer that allows use of bleach in the tank and should not damage seals or other moving parts. Easy to pump up, has a simple lever to operate the valve. Good spray pattern. Recommended I do not know the seller and did not receive any money or product for my review 200106 0927
customer_reviews.author: Runion

customer_reviews.title: does an awesome job
customer_reviews.text: already took it out for a test drive. I always get mildew on my siding on my house. mix in some bleach with some water and dawn and it clean the siding right off. finally finding a sprayer that I can put bleach in was a winner for me. to watch the grime and mildew wash on down was great without any extra work except to rinse off the house with the water hose. I would recommend this sprayer for thoses hard to do jobs.
customer_reviews.author: arnold

customer_reviews.title: Will not spray a fan pattern !!
customer_reviews.text: I want to start out by saying that I have used plenty of pump up sprayers in my time. Most were the higher end. I got this cheaper one to spray sealer on 200' of cedar fencing. I planned on throwing it away when I was done. This sprayer will only spray a stream. I could not make it spray a fan pattern. Not good for what I needed it for. Wasted plenty of water sealer trying though. If you only need a stream, this would work fine. If you need a fan spray, Do not buy. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Don't use Roundup or other weed killers like it.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time trying to figure out how this weed-killer pump works. A neighbor helped me and now it works very well. Instead of Roundup (cancer-causing) use: 1 gal. white vinegar with 1 1/2 c. epsom salts and 2 tbsp. of Dawn.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth C. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Clorox sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I use this chemical sprayer to hold 1 part Clorox and 1 part water to spray in my cool deck for my pool. Works like a charm and gets the job done in half the time. But I recommend not leaving any product in this container for more then 24 hours as it will eat up the nozzle. Would buy again and the price is better then what you will find at the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Wells

customer_reviews.title: OK Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: It works well for the most part. The spraying is a bit inconsistent at times-- spraying strongly and far on one spray and then a lot weaker on the next. Not sure if this is due to this product or something common to all manual pump sprayers. Still, I can get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t t spray. No matter how full or how may times I pump it, the gasket leaks and at best, a few drops drops dribble out at the rate of 2 per second. I’ve looked to see if there is a blockage etc. There isn’t. I now use it as a water bucket. So not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: RedheadwalkingTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, I had a sprayer here which works fine
customer_reviews.text: Step 1. Fill Step 2. Screw in pump handle. Step 2A--watch the contents come straight up through or around the pump, and pool in the funnel top. Note that this was without pumping it up. I will test it with plain water, and see if there's some kind of washer problem somewhere, but given that it was sitting upright, with the pump handle locked in the down position, I rather doubt it. We'll see--perhaps Amazon will let me send it back. Unlike the one guy below, I didn't get any uses from it. Fortunately, I had a sprayer here which works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Purty Good Lil Sprayer...
customer_reviews.text: Good evening! Really quick! I purchased this to spray a insecticide (Tempo) and it works great! Only complaint is it's kinda cheap like most but for the price and it being a Prime Product makes it a great deal! No complaints yet and I've used it half a dozen times. Just be sure after every use, unscrew the pump and let the pressure completely out so you don't wear out any seals. Great buy though!!
customer_reviews.author: Just A Couple

customer_reviews.title: quality sprayer at a low price.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 sprayers, all inexpensive. They glog up or break easily. This one is amazing for the price. Been using it all summer for different mixtures. Works great. Easy to use. If you can turn a big plastic nut, assemble can be performed with your eyes closed...its easy easy. highly recommend this sprayer. Get 2!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffy

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: I understand people wanting a strap on this thing and am jealous of the person who made one. The nozzle can get a little crazy and you have to fiddle with throughout the spraying process but it gets the job done. The latching mechanism is a pain in the butt to figure out but once you do it's smooth sailing. I would like to caution users - make sure you spray out until it stops before you open it. I managed to force it open and got a mist of poison in my face which sent me running for the bathroom in a panic. I know, stupid mistake, but we all make them, right?!......right? ;D
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen H.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable multi-purpose sprayer, but no in-line filter
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer has been very reliable over the years. I used it for weed control, vegetation killer, and pesticide (lawn and home). The Viton seals prevented leaks and pressure loss. The sprayer stopped working because the hose line got clogged. The clog was inaccessible, where the hose connects to the shut-off handle. I learned the hard way of the importance of an in-line filter. For my replacement sprayer, I decided to buy a different brand which has Viton seals and costs less. Another key factor that made me not buy the same model: the recent $9 price increase.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I used this sprayer to tackle wetting down my ceilings before scraping the popcorn off of them. Just pump and spray! Much better than using a spray bottle and killing my arm. The adjuster on the wand allowed me to control the amount of liquid being sprayed which significantly reduced the mess. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JEP

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer Does Not Hold Pressure After 3 Uses - Do not buy ths sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the D.B. Smith 190285 1-Gallon Bleach and Chemical Sprayer. After using the unit 3 times, it does not hold pressure - it appears that there is a leak at the lid seal. I have not used any caustic chemicals/bleach/vinegar - I only used plain water and a car wash shampoo. I have read about similar problems with D.B. Smith sprayers on Amazon and other "big-box" home stores.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Could be dangerous with toxic chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few times before I trashed it. One design problem is that there is no pressure release valve, so you have to open the top, releasing some of whatever is in it into your face. Other problem is that after a few uses, the valve would not shut off properly, so it kept spraying after I tried to stop, even if I cleaned it. You can get something better at Home Depot for 8 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Not working anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened but it quit working. Yesterday when I used it, it sprayed a little and quit. I pumped it and it would spray one squirt and stop. I waited before trying again and same thing happened! Do you have any idea what is wrong with it? I have only used it a couple of time and it worked well before yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: patticake2012

customer_reviews.title: Hand grip is a bit tough to hold over time.
customer_reviews.text: While the main function of the sprayer seems to work fine, there is one function that makes it hard to use. The amount of pressure you need to hold the handle seems excessive to me. After a while, my hand is hurting from the amount of force I have to use. The quality of the sprayer seems fine, but I'll be looking for one which is easier on my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - not suitable for use with powder-based chemical solutions
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is probably great - it worked fine when I tested it with tap water - but the description of the product, both on Amazon and in the packaging, does not include the warning that the sprayer doesn't work with powder-based chemical solutions. I found out the hard way, by clogging the sprayer IMMEDIATELY and then contacting the sprayer company's customer service department. Now I have to figure out a safe way to dispose of a gallon of toxic liquid, and the sprayer would appear to be impossible to unclog, rendering it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to spray cleaner on my exterior vinyl. It was pretty easy to put together and I was happy with the pressure from the spray. The sprayer adjusts from a mist to a steady stream which is nice. The only problem I ran into is occasionally when trying to lock it in the down position I would unscrew the top which released the pressure and sprayed me. This may only be a clumsy/novice mistake though.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey H.

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle was missing
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE-manufacturer quickly sent me nozzles, which was great, but I'm having a lot of trouble getting any pressure. Have to open up the top, tighten it , pump all over again, and maybe once every 3 times I finally get enough pressure to spray. Very frustrating. I may look for another brand. Just mixed up spray and discovered the nozzle was missing on the sprayer. Consequently, I could not properly spray my tree. I just emailed the manufacturer. Hopefully they will quickly ship me a nozzle. If they do, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Does not spray far enough after initial few uses
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this purchase . Used it for 4-5 times in 2019 before fall and it worked perfectly with the spray reaching quite high (I have tall plants which need neem oil stay every few weeks). However when I tried using it again last week it is hardly spraying for around 1 ft! It does not serve my purpose any longer and it is money lost. So please do not buy this product
customer_reviews.author: Deb_B

customer_reviews.title: Worked for over 4 years with a chemical liquid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April of 2013 and I used it to spray Wet and Forget on my house. It worked great many times and I would rinse out the entire unit after each use. This year the shut off valve stopped working and when I cleaned the unit the little spring that controls the valve had completely fallen apart. I wish that the spring had lasted longer or that you could get a replacement part for this sprayer, but I guess at this price it's considered disposable. I will probably just buy another one of these unless I find one that is really better for this chemical use.
customer_reviews.author: K. G.

customer_reviews.title: Went to 100% in two days
customer_reviews.text: Luckily I bought two because in two days they went up 100%. When they get back to $14.99 let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Houston

customer_reviews.title: Abused it for a year...
customer_reviews.text: I've pumped probably a total of 100 gals of bleach and various herbicides through this thing over the last year and it never complained, rusted, or failed in any way. Every other pump sprayer I've tried has had pump seal failures or parts dissolved not long after I bought it. What more can you ask? Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works ok; poor and confusing directins
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these sprayers over the years. This was the most difficult I have ever had to assemble (though still not too tough) , and its directions are generic (for many Smith sprayer models rather than this specific item), with instructions for parts which arent included with this model; which can be confusing. Has no overall picture of the item with labelled parts, but refers to parts in the instructions with names which could apply to several possible things. Works appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: bardo

customer_reviews.title: Smith 190285 1-Gallon Bleach and Chemical Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: If this had a pressure relief valve, I'd give it 4.5 stars, if that was possible. Unless I tighten the "cap" almost to the point of not being able to unscrew it, it doesn't seems to maintain the pressure very long. However, it's easy to fill, the nozzle is very easy to adjust, and it's light weight. If it lasts more than a few seasons, it will be money well spent. (This is the first season of use.)
customer_reviews.author: John_in_NC

customer_reviews.title: Will dissolve if used with vinegar
customer_reviews.text: Used it for spraying vinegar on weeds. Less than a year later valve is compromised. Looks like vinegar dissolved plastic part of valve.
customer_reviews.author: naromero

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs
customer_reviews.text: The pump is plastic and you have to be careful while pumping however for the price it meets my needs for spraying weed killer. I have only used it once and will know more later.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer but lacks relief valve
customer_reviews.text: All Smith sprayers are good performers, this one is no exception. I also use a smaller and larger versions from the same manufacturer and they've been flawless. Both of those have a pressure relief valve which this one lacks - makes it tricky to release the pressure when you're done spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Second review bad deal buy a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's good but had a problem with it leaking air at first with it sealing when screwing it in and the pump doesn't seem that good I mean it pumps up but not good Adding to my review buy a different one now having problems with the sprayer not wanting to stop spraying when releasing the lever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for a Variety of Applications
customer_reviews.text: Works great for spraying decks and walks with bleach, lichens on the roof with vinegar, spot spraying weed killer / Glyphosate, and even spraying sealer on the chimney bricks to prevent freeze damage in the winter. I am very careful to flush the tank, hose, and nozzle out after each use, which I feel is critical for the lifespan of a sprayer. Good size, as I had a 2 gallon tank a while ago and that was a little fatiguing when spot spraying for weeds around the yard. Yes, I have to refill the tank more often, but at least my arms remain of equal length after a morning of spot spraying.
customer_reviews.author: Erik K.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Not a good sprayer. The lever does not restrict the flow of liquid so liquid starts to escape as soon as enough pressure builds up inside. The spring inside the lever was rusted, which could be related to the problem.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: What, no place to store the wand and handle when not in use?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's be but I sort of assume that if the "free with the purchase of product" sparayer has a way to clip the wand into it when it is not being used than the version that I pay for should have that too. It seems as though it maybe was engineered that way when the want was made of something other than the thick plastic tube that this one comes with. There is a grove in the handle but the wand does not fit in it. As a result there is no "neat" way to store this when not in use. Other than that, it sprays - and it does that okay.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Uses a fair amount of stain which is fine spraying "in" toward deck boards
customer_reviews.text: Used to spray stain (oil-based) on my deck rails. (my hand brushing days are behind me). Worked well. Uses a fair amount of stain which is fine spraying "in" toward deck boards. But make sure you cover you border plants just be safe not to kill them off with any over-spray. Also, I read elsewhere that a heavy watering ahead of time helps protect them also.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great for off label uses
customer_reviews.text: I love this sprayer for use with my APC (All Purpose Cleaner) cleaner of choice for mobile detailing! It's saves my hand and wrist from carpal tunnel. I use it to apply APC to tires,wheels,door jams, engine bay, and any other application that may require more than a few spirits of APC.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Davis

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: very easy to set up and use. Made for harsh chems and bleach, I only use it for my roses so it's a bit of a over kill, but I know it will never wear out lake my last one that wasn't made for bleach. Very happy with this!!
customer_reviews.author: steven haudenschild

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer, cheaper than some others
customer_reviews.text: I used this to spray Nu-Calgon condensor cleaner on the outdoor coils of my split ductless systems. It assembles easily, sprays well, and is resistant to corrosion from the alkali cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lionel

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for my Suspend Sc Insecticide. I was a little hesitant to purchase it because I have purchased sprayers in the past at hardware stores, and they failed pretty quickly after purchase. This sprayer was worth the money. I have used it many times with the insecticide, and there have been really no issues. My only complaint is that when I stop spraying, the tip of the sprayer tends to leak and leave a puddle. Nothing horrible, and it's not like is leaks a TON. It's just a half dozen drops or so each time I stop spraying. Other than that, the sprayer works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: catie282

customer_reviews.title: Trigger sticks...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. The trigger mechanism clogs up and sticks. So when you release the trigger the liquid is still coming out. Everything else works fine. One smaller issue is when you are finished pumping to gain pressure, the handle won't stay collapsed and pops out from slight pressure on it
customer_reviews.author: Black Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: broke the first time i refill tank with flagstone sealer. liquid in tank came up through pump plunger. did not even finish first job. don,t wast your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had a total volume of 1 gallon and it was easy to carry and spray
customer_reviews.text: I used this to apply Boracare insecticide. I mixed the 1:1 solution right in the sprayer and with the lid screwed tight it didn't leak or spill even while I was shaking it upside down to ensure full dilution. I had a total volume of 1 gallon and it was easy to carry and spray. The spray nozzle worked adequately but for overhead application it would be nice to have a finer misting like option to prevent droplets from coming down. The nozzle that comes with this is adjustable. Everything is made of plastic so I worry about the wand breaking but as long as you don't handle it roughly there shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Used this to spray roundup on various plants around the house. Everything works as expected. I was really impressed by the build quality of this unit. I had another unit that I felt like the handle was going to break off every time I would pump it. This one is much sturdier and should last a lot longer. Edit - This sprayer didn't last more than a year. The seals on the top keep leaking badly whenever there is moderate pressure. The manufacturer sent me a replacement pump, but that only lasted about 6 months. My cheapo sprayer from my local home improvement store I got for $5 lasted longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A not-so-terrible sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with a wand. So -1 star for that. The pressure of the sprayer isn't exactly the strongest either. If you have to spray far or high then think about getting a different sprayer. Also, no pressure release valve means the sprayer will spray whatever chemical you have in there at your face if you don't open it very slowly or bleed out all of the air first. Overall, the sprayer is ok but needs a wand. I've since obtained an ace brand sprayer that does a lot better though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: Did not last long - for the price it is not worth it. I used it like 20 to 25 times before it become useless. That is like two dollars per use, as I bought it for forty dollars.
customer_reviews.author: ZenDad

customer_reviews.title: Needs a blow off valve or maybe I need to read the directions better and find it
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty solid compared to one I bought a while ago from Home Depot. That one had a nozzle that blew off when I was spraying, never to be found again. Couldn't find replacement parts either. This one seems better built. Wish it had a pressure relief valve. Maybe I missed a that function somewhere but I had to open the top to bleed it which is probably not a god idea if using toxic chemicals or insecticide as it has the tendency to blow back at you. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan005

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: While using this product the pressure inside the container forces the liquid up and out the top of the container. It pools in the funnel portion on top within a couple minutes of pressurizing. It does this when it has a relatively low fill level, so it must be forcing its way up and out the pump. I'm glad I was not using poison as it spilled all over my leg. I would recommend going with a different make and model.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with concrete sealer
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer was purchased to seal our extensive curbing around the flower beds and colored concrete work on our large front and back steps off the porch. These areas must be sealed each year or the color will fade and the concrete won't hold up. This sprayer worked beautifully for us, gave a nice consistent spray and covered well. I'll be honest and say that we discard the sprayer after using and don't bother with any clean-up as the price is so agreeable that we just purchase a new one each year. We are very pleased with the quality and performance of this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: trishaa

customer_reviews.title: After two uses, totally failed product.  Would not keep pressure
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great product the first two times I used it. I made sure to rinse the sprayer after each use. On my third use, it would not keep pressure. I used this sprayer with 30% vinegar for weed control.
customer_reviews.author: rcnav

customer_reviews.title: The nozzle is terrible - no pressure release valve
customer_reviews.text: Find a quality sprayer with a real nozzle. The nozzle on this is very limited in adjustability. It seems to spray out only one side and I have checked everything for blockage and cleaned the nozzle. This sprayer also does not have a pressure release valve. I have used many handheld sprayers and this one doesn't cut it. Spend a few more dollars on a higher quality sprayer. The spring for the shut off corroded after a few years and little usage, without caustic chemical usage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Two Years
customer_reviews.text: Lasted two years before the gasket on the pump assembly failed. Must buy the pump to replace the gasket, (it's about $6). The sprayer is a cheaper model, but I still feel that the gasket shouldn't have shredded so quickly. I only ever used it with a mixture of vinegar, and dish soap, no harsh chemicals or bleach. I wonder how quickly the gasket would have lasted if I regularly ran chemical through it...
customer_reviews.author: Obi-Wan Kaczynski

customer_reviews.title: Little heavy/bulky to carry but works
customer_reviews.text: Need a good number of pumps to build enough pressure. Would be nice to have the max fill line be more noticable/pronounced.
customer_reviews.author: hbhb

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, at a fraction of the bug guy's price!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase. Chemical sprayer was purcased for spraying our home with pesticide ourselves to save $40 bucks monthly. We use a great pest spray mix in a packet that we just drop in the sprayer, fill with water which disolves the packet, and start de-bugging our house shortly thereafter. We havent had to spray but once every 3 months. Easy to use, easy to fill, empty, and clean, and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: VannahRucker

customer_reviews.title: Decent short-range liquid sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Assembly took maybe five minutes and was very intuitive. You have to keep pumping the handle to keep the spray pressure up, but fully pumped the pressure was enough to shoot a stream maybe ten feet, which isn't bad given the price of the unit. If you spray bleach or some other corrosive material, remember to rinse out the reservoir and run a spray of water to clear the lines afterwards. This is definitely no pressure spray cleaner, but if all you need is the ability to spray a liquid while standing out of the splash zone, this will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Ivko Cvejic

customer_reviews.title: I like this one a lot better for the following reasons
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer replaced one I have had for years. I like this one a lot better for the following reasons. 1) The nozzle and tube do not leak 2) The handle snaps into place securely after pumping in the air 3) The size is perfect. My last sprayer was larger and kind of a pain to carry if full. My last sprayer's handle would not lock securely and come loose as I carried it around the yard. My last one also leaked a little, and would cause a mess wherever I stored it, if fluid was left in it.
customer_reviews.author: My two cents

customer_reviews.title: works fine for termidor
customer_reviews.text: I used this to spray Termidor along my foundation. Assembly is easy and make sure to first test it with water to insure all connections are on properly. I found I did not have the hose attached properly. It is better to have water leak out than a chemical, so make sure you test it with water for leaks in the hose or the hose to tank. also gives you a chance to check out the spray pattern. worked flawlessly. no issues. gives a pretty good spray with very few pumps. Locking the handle helps when moving it, and since it only contains a gallon it's not heavy to carry. I plan to pick up another to spray weed killer.
customer_reviews.author: mike in mass

customer_reviews.title: Better than most
customer_reviews.text: I use pool Chlorine on my pool deck for mold. It builds up on my pavers in the cracks even though its sealed. Most sprayers are bulky and hard to move around. This sprayer has the pump handle on the top and easy to carry. Pro's - easy to carry, large opening in top "funneled" so adding mixture and water is a breeze., Pumping light. Cons - You have to turn the handle tight so no air escapes., You have to pump often. The 4 stars is because overall, for the price, its hard to beat, but it is mechanical and not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: James Marino

customer_reviews.title: Works as hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Good instructions. I use it with Roundup and tend to be careless about cleaning sprayers after use. Roundup tends to clog. This is small enough for my needs, and the instructions are easy to follow, so I'm more responsible about cleaning and the sprayer keeps working really well.
customer_reviews.author: j. reader

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with the adjustable nozzle.
customer_reviews.text: It is an inexpensive pump and it leaks. Leaking isn't good, but for my purposes, I was willing to overlook that problem. The rest of the item seems sturdy and well-constructed. Not having the nozzle, however, renders the pump useless.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Used only to apply cleaner on Vinyl fence but worked very well, just made sure to flush with clean water after use - simple and effective. I will be reassessing after I determine its longevity after using weed killer etc but so far very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Floyd T. Turbo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have, or have had, about a dozen sprayers. This is my favorite. Well made, durable, trouble free. Even better: I bought two of these, used one immediately. Many months later, I needed to put the other in use. The second one was missing the nozzle. At the time, I couldn't remember where I bought it or how long ago. Nevertheless, I called the manufacturer. Got someone on the phone right away, and they immediately offered to ship me a nozzle at their cost. This is the kind of customer service we all appreciate and is mostly missing these days! And it's good business: my next several sprayers will be Smiths.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Seal Died FAST
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months the rubber seal at the tip of the black pump, that makes this item work, shriveled up & died. No sign of any way to buy a replacement even. Before that, the item worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, it is effective, it is safe, and durable!
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about the product, and thus far have nothing negative to say. It does exactly what I purchased it for. It is a steal for the money. Everyone should have this at home.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hajtov

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these cheap sprayers over the past 2 years. I consider them to be disposable. The sprayer mechanism, especially the spring, corrodes quickly making it impossible to control the sprayer. The plastic valve wears out quickly. Either you can't shut it off, or you can't turn it on. It's more convenient to replace the entire thing than it is to replace the sprayer assembly. .
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for price!
customer_reviews.text: I think my county has an ordinance against liquid pool chlorine? So I use this for spraying alge off the sidewalks and decking. I leave pieces of a 3" chlorine tablet in it for a week or two and I end up with a very strong concentrate. If you do this be careful of the wind direction!. I have done this a few times in this same container and the seals work great.This is a quality device and clean up is simple.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this only to water plants because carrying around multiple jugs of water was just too much. This one gallon sprayer is enough to water them all thoroughly. This is the first sprayer I've owned so I had a bit of trouble getting it setup. I felt so dumb! The handle feels like it could break when pumping, so bare careful with it. The pressure last long enough for maybe 20-30 seconds of spraying. I pump throughout the whole spray though to keep the pressure high enough. The spraying lasted me about 5 minutes with non-stop spraying.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Drips, Does Not Shut Off
customer_reviews.text: Liquid continues to drip for full minute after releasing handle. Not good if using to spray bleach or herbicides.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dub

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I use this to dilute & spray Monterey Garden Insect Spray (organic spinosad treatment - fights SWD spotted-wing drosophila, leaf miners etc) on my cane berries. I highly recommend this sprayer. I'd never used a sprayer like this before, but this is easy to use and very well made. Wish I'd had one years ago, wold have made spreading NEEM oil on foliage a lot easier! The pump mechanism and sprayer seem solid. It's a mostly-plastic home-use device, but a very nice one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lunachick

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional home use
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer, which is easy to use. Don't over fill it, and don't pressurize it too much. It sprays evenly and is great at the price point. I use this for pest control, and it has worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received May 23rd and have used six times, rinsing out completely after each use. Worked so well, but ONLY six times. Didn't expect it to last years, but did expect it to last one season. Very disappointed, as it supplied a perfect spray when it worked, just dribbles now. Back to a spray bottle, I guess. Not worth the cost of return shipping to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Simple assembly, strong spray, perfect for what I needed (spraying disinfectant). Easy to clean as well. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan E. Buoy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: Great value and does as intended. Only issue would be adjusting from spray to stream. Have to twist and turn to many times to get what I need. The plastic adjusting is just a mechanical issue.
customer_reviews.author: Prizoneroffaith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sprayer. I used it in conjunction with A/C coil cleaner which is pretty caustic stuff. Sprayed it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: BrokeAsAJoke

customer_reviews.title: Not bad - Not great
customer_reviews.text: It builds pressure fast and holds the pressure well. It has a decent nozzle for various spray patterns. The thumb-valve doesn't always shut completely off and has a tendency to drip/leak. But it got me through cleaning my house after moving out. I would recommend this over any off-the-shelf hand held cleaner-spritzer
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Snakob

customer_reviews.title: didn t hold up
customer_reviews.text: used this product for vinegar and water mix to kill lawn weeds. Cylinder seal shriveled up. leaking now on third use.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Decent spry distance
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble and works great for pre treating materials when pressure washing or using to spray the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wood

product_meta.title: Smith 190285 1-Gallon Bleach and Chemical Sprayer for Lawns and Gardens or Cleaning Decks, Siding, and Concrete
product_meta.description: Size:1-(Pack)This sprayer is built for repeated use with the toughest chemicals. It features Viton seals and o-rings, our premium shut-off with comfort grip and lock, 36” long reinforced hose, poly adjustable nozzle and 15” poly wand.
feature_bullets: Easy to use, 1-step assembly. Fill, pressurize and spray
Use with bleach and other harsh chemicals when cleaning bricks, tubs, showers, siding, or even locker rooms
Shut-off has a comfortable grip and will lock on for continuous spraying
Replaceable Viton seals and gaskets throughout pump and wand for chemical resistance and sprayer longevity
Includes poly adjustable nozzle (stream to cone)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,029 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
